content.raw:
Unfortunately we haven't had time to give GzWeb some love and reviews in a while.

This repository is being migrated to GitHub, so I've pulled this branch into the osrf repository for it to be migrated together with the rest of the code. Feel free to reopen the PR on GitHub.
content.html:
Unfortunately we haven't had time to give GzWeb some love and reviews in a while.

This repository is being migrated to GitHub, so I've pulled this branch into the osrf repository for it to be migrated together with the rest of the code. Feel free to reopen the PR on GitHub.

content.raw: Yeah this looks correct, I'll modify the length then.

content.raw: @chapulina yes the do look different with the same numbers.
content.html: @chapulina yes the do look different with the same numbers.

content.raw:
Yeah I was just looking into that. `Box::Size` returns a vector with the length of the X, Y and Z directions, then when we take the length we take the magnitude of that vector. If my math is not mistaken, it should be equivalent.

But! I tried it here and copied the same min/max/scale values from gzclient and the sizes still look different :/
content.html:
Yeah I was just looking into that. Box::Size returns a vector with the length of the X, Y and Z directions, then when we take the length we take the magnitude of that vector. If my math is not mistaken, it should be equivalent.

But! I tried it here and copied the same min/max/scale values from gzclient and the sizes still look different :/

content.raw:
This looks hard to maintain, every time we add a new child to model, we need to come back here and update this not to use that as a link.

In the future, it might be a nice idea to place links under something like `model.links` or to mark links with some flag that identifies them as links. I can already see problems related to nested models.
content.html:
This looks hard to maintain, every time we add a new child to model, we need to come back here and update this not to use that as a link.

In the future, it might be a nice idea to place links under something like model.links or to mark links with some flag that identifies them as links. I can already see problems related to nested models.

content.raw: umm maybe thats what this meant `dPtr->parent->BoundingBox().Size().Length()` from `gzclient` `linkframeVisual.cc` :thinking:
content.html: umm maybe thats what this meant dPtr->parent->BoundingBox().Size().Length() from gzclient linkframeVisual.cc

content.raw: why was I doing that :sweat_smile:
content.html: why was I doing that

content.raw: This is only taking the X size into account, how about taking the box diagonal, like `linkSize = box.min.distanceTo(box.max);`?
content.html: This is only taking the X size into account, how about taking the box diagonal, like linkSize = box.min.distanceTo(box.max);?

content.raw: Is this different from `child = model.children[j]`?
content.html: Is this different from child = model.children[j]?

content.raw: Done, issue #128.
content.html: Done, issue #128.

content.raw: We should ticket issues about supporting all the new visualizations on mobile, this would require adding entries to the radial menu.
content.html: We should ticket issues about supporting all the new visualizations on mobile, this would require adding entries to the radial menu.

content.raw:
@chapulina Well at first I was using the same values from [```gzclient ``` ](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1762/link-frame-visual/diff#Lgazebo/rendering/LinkFrameVisual.ccT46) but apparently that doesn't look very well, so the values I'm using right now are my own, I tried to make the end resulted visual look as similar as possible as gzweb's. 

You can play with the values too and if you like get ones with better results we can use them then.
content.html:
@chapulina Well at first I was using the same values from gzclient but apparently that doesn't look very well, so the values I'm using right now are my own, I tried to make the end resulted visual look as similar as possible as gzweb's.

You can play with the values too and if you like get ones with better results we can use them then.
